meanings.definition: A type of resistor whose resistance varies with temperature.
meanings.sent1: Thermistors are small devices that change how hard electricity can pass through them when it gets hotter or colder.
meanings.sent2: The thermistors in the thermometer help show how warm or cool it is in the room.
meanings.sent3: When the thermistors decided to take a break, the temperature readings went haywire.
meanings.sent4: The thermistors acted like chameleons, adjusting their resistance to blend in with the temperature changes.
meanings.sent5: Imagine thermistors as tiny temperature detectives, always on the lookout for any changes in heat levels.

meanings.definition: Devices used to measure temperature by changes in resistance.
meanings.sent1: The thermistors in the thermometer are the clever tools that detect temperature shifts by changing how much they resist electricity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on thermistors to accurately gauge temperature variations in their experiments.
meanings.sent3: The thermistors threw a party every time the temperature rose, celebrating their resistance drop.
meanings.sent4: In the world of temperature measurement, thermistors are the silent heroes that adapt to any resistance challenge.
meanings.sent5: The thermistors' ability to transform resistance into temperature readings is truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: Thermistors are like tiny detectives that spot even the slightest temperature changes.
meanings.sent2: The thermistors in the room alert the system when the temperature shifts unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The thermistors giggled with excitement every time they caught a temperature fluctuation.
meanings.sent4: Like vigilant guardians, the thermistors keep a watchful eye on any temperature variations.
meanings.sent5: The thermistors' sensitivity to temperature changes is unmatched, making them essential sensors in many devices.
